newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Plane with 95 crashes in Sao Paulo, all feared dead.
newsitem.headline: Plane with 95 crashes in Sao Paulo, all feared dead.

text.p: A Fokker-100 aircraft operated by Brazil's TAM airline crashed soon after take-off into a densely populated area of Sao Paulo on Thursday, and all 95 people on board were feared dead, authorities said.
Television news footage showed burning wreckage of the plane strewn amid three blocks of homes in the middle-class southwest neighbourhood of Parque Jabaquara.
Firemen removed the dead from the wreckage and at least 30 bodies were lined up near the site of the crash.

Authorities at the scene said it was unlikely that anyone survived the Rio de Janeiro bound flight 402, which crashed just before 8:30 a.m./5:30 a.m. EST (1030 GMT) shortly after taking off from Sao Paulo's Congonhas regional airport.
A TAM spokesman said the plane was carrying 89 passengers and six crew members.
Firemen said there appeared to be several dead in homes struck by the plane.
Authorities said the plane skidded over several rooftops, tore through the second floor of a neighbourhood store and then ploughed directly through several homes before coming to a stop.
"Parts of the plane fell on my roof and in my backyard. We heard a big crash and then windows and glass went flying all over the place," said housewife Eusa da Silva.
"We ran outside and all the neighbours were out screaming. Nobody knew what was going on," she said.
Chunks of fuselage, mortar and brick were strewn throughout a three block area where the plane came down, some 2 miles (3.2 km) from the airport.
The plane barrelled through the neighbourhood, as residents were on their way to work.
